body_html:
For your specific case, you need to set the state_dict of your model with the parameters that were saved, see here for one example.

Also, we use github issues for bugs and feature requests. Questions are better suited for the forums https://discuss.pytorch.org/
body_text:
For your specific case, you need to set the state_dict of your model with the parameters that were saved, see here for one example.
Also, we use github issues for bugs and feature requests. Questions are better suited for the forums https://discuss.pytorch.org/
body:
For your specific case, you need to set the `state_dict` of your model with the parameters that were saved, see [here](https://github.com/pytorch/examples/blob/master/imagenet/main.py#L104) for one example.

Also, we use github issues for bugs and feature requests. Questions are better suited for the forums https://discuss.pytorch.org/
